title: Brochure design
content:
Hi, I’m working on a book and would like to include some great examples of brochures used to market typography. I need high-resolution files and information to credit designer and other production information. Any help would be most appreciated. The sooner the better. Thanks.

 [‹ Text face?](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222214638/http:/typophile.com/node/39138 "Go to previous forum topic") [Meta + DIN hybrid? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222214638/http:/typophile.com/node/39129 "Go to next forum topic")
author: marj

comments.content:
Hi Marjorie,

so, it’s about print brochures. But not about [specimen](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222214638/http:/typophile.com/wiki/specimen)? Most often, these two forms are intermingled.  
Do you know [Spatium issue Nº 5; ‘hamburgefonts’](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222214638/http:/www.typophile.com/node/30378)?

<cite>to market typography</cite>  
That is, (new) typeface designs? By foundries/distributors? Historic or contemporary?

What have you got already?

F

Hi Florian, I have mostly design-based brochures now and was looking for something a little different so I thought of type designers. Thanks for the jpgs, however I’d consider them less what I’m looking for. I need to show examples of non-traditional (not 6-panel, two-fold) brochures and thought ’how would a type designer market themselves?’ The book I’m working on is more geared for the small business owner, and I was hoping some of those who frequent this site might have examples they use for marketing their services.

And yes, it’s more about print brochures than specimens. However I think some of the the things “Emigre” did early on are interesting. I’m looking for non-traditional thinking. For example, one of the designs I’ve gotten is assembled with a rivet and looks more like how a Pantone swatch book is assembled. I’m looking for anything BUT the two-fold, six panel brochure that fits into a #10 envelope. And what better way to expose a non-designer to typography??!!

Thanks.  
Marj Crum

Marj,

I would contact foundries directly with your request.  
Here are just a few...

[Fontshop](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222214638/http:/www.fontshop.com/)

[Emigre](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222214638/http:/www.emigre.com/)

Hi Chris, great ideas thanks. I was also hoping to get some designers who have things available too as my timeline is very tight.  
M
